Last week, the Boca Raton Planning & Zoning Board recommended against the application of Suspended Animation Inc. to build a laboratory. ... Experiments would be done on about 100 rats a year, the company has said. This has brought furious opposition from animal-rights supporters -- though I'll bet many other animal lovers would gladly off a few rats if it meant a chance to bring their Fido back.
In voting 6-0 against Suspended Animation's application, Planning & Zoning Board members said they weren't swayed by the animal-rights crowd or by suspicions that cryonics is more Woody Allen's Sleeper than an actual science. They said the business just didn't fit city plans.
